title: Biden Would be Very Strong on China, Says Mastercard's Froman
text: Michael Froman, former U.S. Trade Representative and Mastercard Inc. vice chairman, says that Democratic nominee Joe Biden would hold China accountable for its effect on the rest of the global economy. He also says that the Covid-19 crisis has shown that corporations need to create long-term value. He joins David Westin on "Bloomberg Wall Street Week."

title: Stock Market Update: The ‘Picture-Perfect’ Grand Finale
text: For our final stock market update with Mike Webster, we’re going out with a bang. Mike analyzes a key historical precedent that serves as a potential blueprint for where we are in this raging bull market.

title: This S&P 500 Metric is at its Highest Level Ever: What Can Can Investors Do?
text: By Eric Dutram, Contributor, DWS When you buy an investment tracking a benchmark such the S&P 500 Index, do you know what you are getting? Sure, it sounds simple at first.

title: Gold Futures Trading Update (August 21): Watch Support!

text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average closed at 27,930.33 on Friday with a gain of 190.60 points or 0.69%.

title: CalSTRS CIO Ailman Sees 'Choppy' Recovery Outside of Tech
text: Christopher Ailman, chief investment officer of the California State Teachers’ Retirement System (CalSTRS), says it's going to take a long time for the U.S. economy to recover from the Covid-19 pandemic. He speaks during an interview with Bloomberg's Romaine Bostick, Caroline Hyde and Taylor Riggs on "Bloomberg Markets: The Close."

title: BlackRock's Pyle Sees 'Chicken and Egg Problem' for Stimulus
text: Mike Pyle, BlackRock Inc. global chief investment strategist, says the lack of volatility in markets could be to blame for why Congress hasn't agreed on a stimulus package. He speaks with Bloomberg's Taylor Riggs on "Bloomberg The Open."

title: Bifurcated Stock Market Frustrating Bulls and Bears
text: Not all stock market indices are moving to new highs, and it’s important to reiterate this point. The Dow Jones Industrial Average, Russell 2000, Dow Transportation Average, and Value Line Geometric Index (equal-weighted 1500 names) have NOT moved to new high territory.

title: U.S., EU hatch mini-deal to cut lobster, other tariffs
text: The United States and the European Union have hatched a mini-deal to cut imports tariffs on a small range of products, including U.S. lobsters, in a sign of an easing of transatlantic trade tensions.

title: Former Fed officials slam Trump's central bank pick and urge Senate to reject her nomination
text: More than 40 former Federal Reserve officials blasted President Donald Trump's nominee for a key central bank position, calling her views "extreme and ill-considered," and urging the Senate to reject her nomination.

title: Chinese EV maker XPeng looks to raise up to $1.11 billion in U.S. IPO
text: Chinese electric vehicle (EV) manufacturer XPeng Inc said it hopes to raise up to $1.11 billion in its initial public offering (IPO) in New York, seeking to ride the enthusiasm for EVs even as U.S.-China relations remain strained.

title: US home sales hit a 14-year high amid coronavirus pandemic
text: US home sales rose at a record pace for a second straight month in July and home prices hit a record as historically low interest rates boosted demand for homes even as the coronavirus pandemic put millions of people out of work. The National Association of Realtors said on Friday existing home sales rose 24.7.

title: Why the U.S. Dollar Remains Strong | WSJ
text: Despite many pundits predicting that the U.S. dollar would lose its global dominance, the coronavirus pandemic has only served to demonstrate how vital it remains to the international financial system. WSJ explains why this isn’t the first crisis to do so.
